front.div:
Abstract
To identify senescence-associated genes (SAGs) in
rice leaves, senescence was induced by trans-
ferring rice seedlings into darkness. Senescence
up-regulated cDNAs were obtained by PCR-based
subtractive hybridization. Among 14 SAG clones
characterized, 11 were found to be associated with
both dark-induced and natural leaf senescence.
Three clones were associated only with dark-induced
leaf senescence. The possible physiological roles
of these SAGs during rice leaf senescence are
discussed.
